‚à•wi,qŒ©‚Äã(t)‚àíwt‚à•2superscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptsubscriptùë§ùëñùëûŒ©ùë°superscriptùë§ùë°2\displaystyle\left\lVert w_{i,q}^{\Omega(t)}-w^{t}\right\rVert^{2} ‚â§œÑ‚Äã(1+1Œ≤2)‚Äã[‚àës=t‚àíœÑt‚àí1‚à•ws+1‚àíws‚à•2‚èü=‚Å£:Sc3]+(1+Œ≤2)‚Äã‚à•wŒ©‚Äã(t)‚àíwi,qŒ©‚Äã(t)‚à•2‚èü=‚Å£:Sc2.absentùúè11superscriptùõΩ2delimited-[]superscriptsubscriptùë†ùë°ùúèùë°1subscript‚èüsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùë§ùë†1superscriptùë§ùë†2:absentsubscriptùëÜsubscriptùëê31superscriptùõΩ2subscript‚èüsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùë§Œ©ùë°superscriptsubscriptùë§ùëñùëûŒ©ùë°2:absentsubscriptùëÜsubscriptùëê2\displaystyle\leq\tau\left(1{+}\frac{1}{\beta^{2}}\right)\left[\sum\limits_{s{=}t{-}\tau}^{t{-}1}\underbrace{\left\lVert w^{s{+}1}-w^{s}\right\rVert^{2}}_{=:S_{c_{3}}}\right]+\left(1{+}\beta^{2}\right)\underbrace{\left\lVert w^{\Omega(t)}-w_{i,q}^{\Omega(t)}\right\rVert^{2}}_{=:S_{c_{2}}}. (212)

Now, if we introduce stepsize Œ∑ùúÇ\eta such that Œ∑‚â§14‚ÄãLc‚Äã(Q+1)ùúÇ14subscriptùêøùëêùëÑ1\eta\leq\frac{1}{4L_{c}(Q{+}1)}, similar to (70)-(75) and (83)-(87), the following two inequalities holds for Sc2subscriptùëÜsubscriptùëê2S_{c_{2}} and Sc3subscriptùëÜsubscriptùëê3S_{c_{3}}:

ùîº[\displaystyle\mathbb{E}[ Sc2]=ùîº‚à•wi,qŒ©‚Äã(t)‚àíwŒ©‚Äã(t)‚à•2\displaystyle S_{c_{2}}]=\mathbb{E}\left\lVert w_{i,q}^{\Omega(t)}-w^{\Omega(t)}\right\rVert^{2} (213)
‚â§8‚ÄãQ‚Äã(1+2‚ÄãQ)‚ÄãŒ∑2‚Äã[œÉc2+ùîº‚Äã‚à•‚àáFi(c)‚Äã(wŒ©‚Äã(t))‚àí‚àáF(c)‚Äã(wŒ©‚Äã(t))‚à•2+ùîº‚Äã‚à•‚àáF(c)‚Äã(wŒ©‚Äã(t))‚à•2],absent8ùëÑ12ùëÑsuperscriptùúÇ2delimited-[]superscriptsubscriptùúéùëê2ùîºsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•‚àásubscriptsuperscriptùêπùëêùëñsuperscriptùë§Œ©ùë°‚àásuperscriptùêπùëêsuperscriptùë§Œ©ùë°2ùîºsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•‚àásuperscriptùêπùëêsuperscriptùë§Œ©ùë°2\displaystyle\leq 8Q(1{+}2Q)\eta^{2}\Bigg{[}\sigma_{c}^{2}+\mathbb{E}\Big{\lVert}\nabla F^{(c)}_{i}\left(w^{\Omega(t)}\right)-\nabla F^{(c)}\left(w^{\Omega(t)}\right)\Big{\rVert}^{2}+\mathbb{E}\Big{\lVert}\nabla F^{(c)}\left(w^{\Omega(t)}\right)\Big{\rVert}^{2}\Bigg{]},
ùîº‚Äã[Sc3]ùîºdelimited-[]subscriptùëÜsubscriptùëê3\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[S_{c_{3}}\right] =ùîº‚Äã‚à•ws+1‚àíws‚à•2‚â§8‚ÄãQ‚Äã(1+2‚ÄãQ)‚ÄãŒ∑2‚ÄãŒ≤2‚Äã[œÉc2+Œ≥c2+ùîº‚Äã‚à•‚àáF(c)‚Äã(wŒ©‚Äã(s))‚à•2],absentùîºsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•superscriptùë§ùë†1superscriptùë§ùë†28ùëÑ12ùëÑsuperscriptùúÇ2superscriptùõΩ2delimited-[]superscriptsubscriptùúéùëê2superscriptsubscriptùõæùëê2ùîºsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•‚àásuperscriptùêπùëêsuperscriptùë§Œ©ùë†2\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}\left\lVert w^{s{+}1}-w^{s}\right\rVert^{2}\leq 8Q(1{+}2Q)\eta^{2}\beta^{2}\Bigg{[}\sigma_{c}^{2}+\gamma_{c}^{2}+\mathbb{E}\Big{\lVert}\nabla F^{(c)}\left(w^{\Omega(s)}\right)\Big{\rVert}^{2}\Bigg{]}, (214)

where by denoting œï=8‚ÄãŒ∑2‚ÄãQ2‚Äã(1+2‚ÄãQ)‚Äã(1+Œ≤2)italic-œï8superscriptùúÇ2superscriptùëÑ212ùëÑ1superscriptùõΩ2\phi=8\eta^{2}Q^{2}(1{+}2Q)(1{+}\beta^{2}), we have

1n‚Äãœï‚Äãùîº‚Äã[Sc1]1ùëõitalic-œïùîºdelimited-[]subscriptùëÜsubscriptùëê1\displaystyle\frac{1}{n\phi}\mathbb{E}[S_{c_{1}}] ‚â§(œÑ2+1)‚Äã[œÉc2+Œ≥c2]+œÑ‚Äã‚àës=t‚àíœÑt‚àëu=s‚àíœÑsùîº‚Äã‚à•‚àáF(c)‚Äã(wu)‚à•2.absentsuperscriptùúè21delimited-[]superscriptsubscriptùúéùëê2superscriptsubscriptùõæùëê2ùúèsuperscriptsubscriptùë†ùë°ùúèùë°superscriptsubscriptùë¢ùë†ùúèùë†ùîºsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•‚àásuperscriptùêπùëêsuperscriptùë§ùë¢2\displaystyle\leq(\tau^{2}{+}1)\left[\sigma_{c}^{2}+\gamma_{c}^{2}\right]+\tau\sum_{s=t{-}\tau}^{t}\sum_{u=s{-}\tau}^{s}\mathbb{E}\Big{\lVert}\nabla F^{(c)}\left(w^{u}\right)\Big{\rVert}^{2}. (215)

Then, according to (209)-(215), we obtain

ùîº‚ÄãF(c)ùîºsuperscriptùêπùëê\displaystyle\mathbb{E}F^{(c)} (wt+1)‚â§ùîº‚ÄãF(c)‚Äã(wt)‚àí[Œ∑‚ÄãŒ≤‚Äã(2‚ÄãQ‚àí1)2‚àí2‚ÄãŒ∑2‚ÄãLc‚ÄãŒ≤2‚ÄãQ2]‚Äãùîº‚Äã‚à•‚àáF(c)‚Äã(wt)‚à•2superscriptùë§ùë°1ùîºsuperscriptùêπùëêsuperscriptùë§ùë°delimited-[]ùúÇùõΩ2ùëÑ122superscriptùúÇ2subscriptùêøùëêsuperscriptùõΩ2superscriptùëÑ2ùîºsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•‚àásuperscriptùêπùëêsuperscriptùë§ùë°2\displaystyle(w^{t{+}1})\leq\mathbb{E}F^{(c)}(w^{t})-\left[\frac{\eta\beta(2Q{-}1)}{2}-2\eta^{2}L_{c}\beta^{2}Q^{2}\right]\mathbb{E}\left\lVert\nabla F^{(c)}(w^{t})\right\rVert^{2} (216)
+8‚ÄãŒ∑3‚ÄãŒ≤‚ÄãQ3‚ÄãLc2‚Äã(1+2‚ÄãQ)‚Äã(1+Œ≤2)‚Äã(1+2‚ÄãŒ∑‚ÄãŒ≤‚ÄãLc)‚ÄãœÑ‚Äã[‚àës=t‚àíœÑt‚àëu=s‚àíœÑsùîº‚Äã‚à•‚àáF(c)‚Äã(wu)‚à•2]8superscriptùúÇ3ùõΩsuperscriptùëÑ3superscriptsubscriptùêøùëê212ùëÑ1superscriptùõΩ212ùúÇùõΩsubscriptùêøùëêùúèdelimited-[]superscriptsubscriptùë†ùë°ùúèùë°superscriptsubscriptùë¢ùë†ùúèùë†ùîºsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•‚àásuperscriptùêπùëêsuperscriptùë§ùë¢2\displaystyle+8\eta^{3}\beta Q^{3}L_{c}^{2}(1{+}2Q)(1{+}\beta^{2})\left(1{+}2\eta\beta L_{c}\right)\tau\left[\sum\limits_{s{=}t{-}\tau}^{t}\sum\limits_{u{=}s{-}\tau}^{s}\mathbb{E}\left\lVert\nabla F^{(c)}(w^{u})\right\rVert^{2}\right] (217)
+8‚ÄãŒ∑3‚ÄãŒ≤‚ÄãQ3‚ÄãLc2‚Äã(1+2‚ÄãQ)‚Äã(œÑ2+1)‚Äã(1+Œ≤2)‚Äã(1+2‚ÄãŒ∑‚ÄãŒ≤‚ÄãLc)‚Äã(œÉc2+Œ≥c2)8superscriptùúÇ3ùõΩsuperscriptùëÑ3superscriptsubscriptùêøùëê212ùëÑsuperscriptùúè211superscriptùõΩ212ùúÇùõΩsubscriptùêøùëêsuperscriptsubscriptùúéùëê2superscriptsubscriptùõæùëê2\displaystyle+8\eta^{3}\beta Q^{3}L_{c}^{2}(1{+}2Q)(\tau^{2}{+}1)(1{+}\beta^{2})\left(1{+}2\eta\beta L_{c}\right)\left(\sigma_{c}^{2}+\gamma_{c}^{2}\right) (218)
+2‚ÄãŒ∑2‚ÄãLc‚ÄãŒ≤2‚ÄãQ2‚Äã(œÉc2+Œ≥c2)2superscriptùúÇ2subscriptùêøùëêsuperscriptùõΩ2superscriptùëÑ2superscriptsubscriptùúéùëê2superscriptsubscriptùõæùëê2\displaystyle+2\eta^{2}L_{c}\beta^{2}Q^{2}\left(\sigma_{c}^{2}+\gamma_{c}^{2}\right) (219)
+Œ∑‚ÄãŒ≤‚ÄãQ2‚ÄãŒºc2,ùúÇùõΩsuperscriptùëÑ2superscriptsubscriptùúáùëê2\displaystyle+\eta\beta Q^{2}\mu_{c}^{2}, (220)

where by averaging the terms in (216)-(220), for t=0,1,‚Ä¶‚ÄãT‚àí1ùë°01‚Ä¶ùëá1t=0,1,\dots T{-}1, and rearranging them (similar to (103)-(105), we can conclude the following inequality:

1‚àí4‚ÄãŒ∑‚ÄãŒ≤‚ÄãQ‚ÄãLc‚àí16‚ÄãŒ∑2‚ÄãQ2‚ÄãLc2‚Äã(1+2‚ÄãQ)‚ÄãœÑ‚Äã(œÑ+1)2‚Äã(1+Œ≤2)‚Äã(1+2‚ÄãŒ∑‚ÄãŒ≤‚ÄãLc)T‚Äã‚àët=0T‚àí1ùîº‚Äã‚à•‚àáF(c)‚Äã(wt)‚à•214ùúÇùõΩùëÑsubscriptùêøùëê16superscriptùúÇ2superscriptùëÑ2superscriptsubscriptùêøùëê212ùëÑùúèsuperscriptùúè121superscriptùõΩ212ùúÇùõΩsubscriptùêøùëêùëásuperscriptsubscriptùë°0ùëá1ùîºsuperscriptdelimited-‚à•‚à•‚àásuperscriptùêπùëêsuperscriptùë§ùë°2\displaystyle\frac{1-4\eta\beta QL_{c}-16\eta^{2}Q^{2}L_{c}^{2}(1{+}2Q)\tau(\tau{+}1)^{2}(1{+}\beta^{2})\left(1{+}2\eta\beta L_{c}\right)}{T}\sum\limits_{t=0}^{T{-}1}\mathbb{E}\left\lVert\nabla F^{(c)}(w^{t})\right\rVert^{2}
‚â§2‚Äã(F(c)‚Äã(w0)‚àíùîº‚ÄãF(c)‚Äã(wT))Œ∑‚ÄãŒ≤‚ÄãQ‚ÄãT+2‚ÄãQ‚ÄãŒºc2absent2superscriptùêπùëêsuperscriptùë§0ùîºsuperscriptùêπùëêsuperscriptùë§ùëáùúÇùõΩùëÑùëá2ùëÑsuperscriptsubscriptùúáùëê2\displaystyle\leq\frac{2\left(F^{(c)}(w^{0})-\mathbb{E}F^{(c)}(w^{T})\right)}{\eta\beta QT}+2Q\mu_{c}^{2} (221)
+16‚ÄãŒ∑2‚ÄãQ2‚ÄãLc2‚Äã(1+2‚ÄãQ)‚Äã(œÑ2+1)‚Äã(1+Œ≤2)‚Äã(1+2‚ÄãŒ∑‚ÄãŒ≤‚ÄãLc)‚Äã(œÉc2+Œ≥c2)16superscriptùúÇ2superscriptùëÑ2superscriptsubscriptùêøùëê212ùëÑsuperscriptùúè211superscriptùõΩ212ùúÇùõΩsubscriptùêøùëêsuperscriptsubscriptùúéùëê2superscriptsubscriptùõæùëê2\displaystyle+16\eta^{2}Q^{2}L_{c}^{2}(1{+}2Q)(\tau^{2}{+}1)(1{+}\beta^{2})\left(1{+}2\eta\beta L_{c}\right)\left(\sigma_{c}^{2}+\gamma_{c}^{2}\right) (222)
+4‚ÄãŒ∑‚ÄãŒ≤‚ÄãQ‚ÄãLc‚Äã(œÉc2+Œ≥c2)4ùúÇùõΩùëÑsubscriptùêøùëêsuperscriptsubscriptùúéùëê2superscriptsubscriptùõæùëê2\displaystyle+4\eta\beta QL_{c}\left(\sigma_{c}^{2}+\gamma_{c}^{2}\right) (223)

Finally, by fixing Œ∑=1Q‚ÄãLc‚ÄãTùúÇ1ùëÑsubscriptùêøùëêùëá\eta=\frac{1}{Q\sqrt{L_{c}T}}, for T‚â•288‚ÄãLc‚Äã(Q+7)‚Äã(œÑ+1)2ùëá288subscriptùêøùëêùëÑ7superscriptùúè12T\geq 288L_{c}(Q{+}7)(\tau{+}1)^{2}, we obtain the sublinear convergence rate in Theorem 3. ‚àé

Appendix D Experiments Setting

For all algorithms, we consider Q=10ùëÑ10Q=10 local updates, and select the best Œª‚àà{20,25,30}ùúÜ202530\lambda\in\{20,25,30\} for ME and Œ±‚àà{0.002,0.005,0.01}ùõº0.0020.0050.01\alpha\in\{0.002,0.005,0.01\} for MAML. Moreover, we pick Œ≤‚àà{0.8,1.0,1.2}ùõΩ0.81.01.2\beta\in\{0.8,1.0,1.2\} and fix Œ∑=0.01ùúÇ0.01\eta=0.01. For all experiments, we consider the exact same communication setup and repeat each experiment 222 to 333 times and plot the test accuracy curve over time until one of the algorithms converges. We consider n=30ùëõ30n=30 agents for all experiments. Moreover, for both datasets we consider ‚Ñì‚Ñì\ell-layer CNN networks [39] followed by ‚Ñì‚Ñì\ell-fully connected layers with pooling and dropout as well as cross-entropy loss, where ‚Ñì=2‚Ñì2\ell=2 for MNIST and ‚Ñì=3‚Ñì3\ell=3 for CIFAR-10. Also, for MNIST we consider c=5ùëê5c=5 class of samples for each client while for CIFAR we create heterogeneity by considering c=3ùëê3c=3 per client.

It is worth mentioning that in the implementation of algorithms with MAML, we approximated the Hessian-vector products via the following first-order formulation: for some small Œ¥>0ùõø0\delta>0,

‚àá2fi‚Äã(w)‚Äãu‚âà‚àáfi‚Äã(w+Œ¥‚Äãu)‚àí‚àáfi‚Äã(w‚àíŒ¥‚Äãu)Œ¥.superscript‚àá2subscriptùëìùëñùë§ùë¢‚àásubscriptùëìùëñùë§ùõøùë¢‚àásubscriptùëìùëñùë§ùõøùë¢ùõø\displaystyle\nabla^{2}f_{i}(w)u\approx\frac{\nabla f_{i}(w+\delta u)-\nabla f_{i}(w-\delta u)}{\delta}. (224)

Moreover, in the bi-level optimization problem for the ME formulation, we applied a constant K=10ùêæ10K=10 steps of SGD to obtain Œ∏~i‚Äã(w)subscript~ùúÉùëñùë§\tilde{\theta}_{i}(w).
